com.dhemery.expressions

Interface Poller

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PolledExpressions, PollTimerPoller

    public interface Poller
    Repeatedly evaluates a condition until it is satisfied or the polling duration expires.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean poll(PollingSchedule schedule, SelfDescribingBooleanSupplier supplier)
      Polls the supplier.
      <T,V> PollEvaluationResult<V> poll(PollingSchedule schedule, T subject, SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function, Matcher<? super V> matcher)
      Polls the matcher's acceptance of the value that the function derives from the subject.
      <T,V> PollEvaluationResult<V> poll(PollingSchedule schedule, T subject, SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function, SelfDescribingPredicate<? super V> predicate)
      Polls the matcher's acceptance of the value that the function derives from the subject.
      <T> boolean poll(PollingSchedule schedule, T subject, SelfDescribingPredicate<? super T> predicate)
      Polls the predicate's acceptance of the subject.

    • Method Detail

      • poll

        boolean poll(PollingSchedule schedule,
             SelfDescribingBooleanSupplier supplier)
        Polls the supplier.
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        supplier - the supplier to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the supplier returns true before the schedule expires, otherwise false

      • poll

        <T> boolean poll(PollingSchedule schedule,
                 T subject,
                 SelfDescribingPredicate<? super T> predicate)
        Polls the predicate's acceptance of the subject.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        predicate - evaluates the subject
        Returns:
        true if the predicate accepts the subject before the schedule expires, otherwise false

      • poll

        <T,V> PollEvaluationResult<V> poll(PollingSchedule schedule,
                                   T subject,
                                   SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function,
                                   Matcher<? super V> matcher)
        Polls the matcher's acceptance of the value that the function derives from the subject.

        The return value includes the value derived by the function during the final evaluation, and indicates whether that value satisfied the matcher.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        V - the type of the derived value
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        function - derives the value of interest from the subject
        matcher - evaluates the derived value
        Returns:
        the result of the final evaluation performed by this poll

      • poll

        <T,V> PollEvaluationResult<V> poll(PollingSchedule schedule,
                                   T subject,
                                   SelfDescribingFunction<? super T,V> function,
                                   SelfDescribingPredicate<? super V> predicate)
        Polls the matcher's acceptance of the value that the function derives from the subject.

        The return value includes the value derived by the function during the final evaluation, and indicates whether that value satisfied the predicate.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the subject
        V - the type of the derived value
        Parameters:
        schedule - the polling interval and duration
        subject - the subject to evaluate
        function - derives the value of interest from the subject
        predicate - evaluates the derived value
        Returns:
        the result of the final evaluation performed by this poll
